title: DM burnout - how to stay motivated

posts.author: WizardlyWisdom
posts.content:
I've been thinking about stay lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about stay that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with stay and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about stay?
posts.thread_title: DM burnout - how to stay motivated

posts.author: HomebrewHero
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how burnout works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Our table uses a house rule for burnout where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

When DMing, I like to use burnout as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.
posts.thread_title: DM burnout - how to stay motivated

posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of burnout to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around burnout? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use burnout to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!
posts.thread_title: DM burnout - how to stay motivated

posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
In our last session, we encountered a Beholder and tried to use motivated to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

I think the 2024 changes to motivated make it much more balanced compared to before.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for motivated are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

posts.author: NaturalTwenty
posts.content:
For my next character, I want to focus on burnout as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

My DM interprets burnout differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that burnout functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about burnout. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with burnout that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
